title:
Ensure 'Downloaded Maps Manager (MapsBroker)' is set
to 'Disabled'
description:
Windows service for application access to downloaded maps. This service is started on-
demand by application accessing downloaded maps.
rationale:
Mapping technologies can unwillingly reveal your location to attackers and other
software that picks up the information. In addition, automatic downloads of data from
third-party sources should be minimized when not needed. Therefore, this service
should not be needed in high security environments.
impact: Applications will be prevented from accessing maps data.
audit_procedure:
Navigate to the UI Path articulated in the Remediation section and confirm it is set as
prescribed. This group policy setting is backed by the following registry location with a
REG_DWORD value of 4.
HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\MapsBroker:Start
remediation_procedure:
To establish the recommended configuration, run the following PowerShell command:
Set-Service -Name MapsBroker -StartupType Disabled
default_value:
Automatic (Delayed Start)
